componenttext: Your next question comes from Lauren Lieberman with Barclays.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: I wanted to talk about first on North America flavors. That business came in a bit lighter than I expected and I remember there being some business that was expected to be commercialized in the second half, a big win so just wondering if that happened, if
componenttext: I wanted to talk about first on North America flavors. That business came in a bit lighter than I expected and I remember there being some business that was expected to be commercialized in the second half, a big win so just wondering if that happened, if there was another delay or what the situation is there.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: So I would say just a challenging environment in North America for us at the moment. No, I think that's what I would comment. And that makes it even more important for us that with the 2 acquisitions, David Michael and Ottens, that we bring it together as
componenttext: So I would say just a challenging environment in North America for us at the moment. No, I think that's what I would comment. And that makes it even more important for us that with the 2 acquisitions, David Michael and Ottens, that we bring it together as our platform for the midmarket because that's where we see the growth and that's our main objective right now, to become the leader for the midmarket in the smaller customers and I think when that's happening, you will see growth this will now because with these 2 companies in our portfolio, we have enough critical mass to move a big market like North America for us.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Lauren, from a category standpoint, I'd say Beverage was down and just on the other side, Savory and Sweet were up slightly but not enough to offset the weakness that we saw in Beverage.
componenttext: Lauren, from a category standpoint, I'd say Beverage was down and just on the other side, Savory and Sweet were up slightly but not enough to offset the weakness that we saw in Beverage.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, great. And then also, I was struck by the comments in the release and in the earnings bridge on the difference between input costs and pricing and then I think in the Q, you talked about a fairly benign input cost environment so could you just help
componenttext: Okay, great. And then also, I was struck by the comments in the release and in the earnings bridge on the difference between input costs and pricing and then I think in the Q, you talked about a fairly benign input cost environment so could you just help me understand, triangulate those two?

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, sure. I mean, it's a combination of factors, Lauren. I think we saw price input pressures in both businesses on the Flavors side. It's really driven by the price increases on naturals and the inventory levels that we have where we're experiencing the
componenttext: Yes, sure. I mean, it's a combination of factors, Lauren. I think we saw price input pressures in both businesses on the Flavors side. It's really driven by the price increases on naturals and the inventory levels that we have where we're experiencing the impacts of those very, very quickly. Vanilla is certainly one of those key aspects that we're seeing that pressure. As Andreas talked about, I mean, the acquisition of David Michael will help us on that aspect. On the fragrance side, it's really a couple of things. One, from a pricing standpoint, it's been more about pricing pressure from a customer standpoint and then the second piece is really related to our ingredients business. We are -- we've wanted to address the declines in that business and we've gone and look at our go-to-market strategy and want to protect our market share more aggressively and so we've had to adjust pricing accordingly. On the compound side, it's more about pricing pressure from the customers and what's necessary to defend the business that we have today.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. So then looking forward into next year, then that would suggest as sort of a more price constrained marketplace than maybe we would've expected 6, 9, 12, 24 months ago, is that reasonable?
componenttext: Okay. So then looking forward into next year, then that would suggest as sort of a more price constrained marketplace than maybe we would've expected 6, 9, 12, 24 months ago, is that reasonable?

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, Lauren, I don't want to go into too much detail. We'll have more clarity in February, but I would say that what we're seeing today and what we expected a, that pricing input costs will be up next year, not huge amounts like we've seen in the past but
componenttext: Yes, Lauren, I don't want to go into too much detail. We'll have more clarity in February, but I would say that what we're seeing today and what we expected a, that pricing input costs will be up next year, not huge amounts like we've seen in the past but it's going to be up and that's going to be principally driven by naturals in both businesses, as well as some of the downstream effects of oil-related derivatives as we've gone from $30, $40 a barrel up to $50 a barrel.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Right but at the same time, your ability to price to recover some of that is more constrained?
componenttext: Right but at the same time, your ability to price to recover some of that is more constrained?

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, I mean, certainly on the fragrance side, yes.
componenttext: Yes, I mean, certainly on the fragrance side, yes.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And would the thought be to accelerate productivity to try to make up that gap because it definitely sounds like the fragrance business were a little bit less stability to recover costs and the naturals exposure?
componenttext: Okay. And would the thought be to accelerate productivity to try to make up that gap because it definitely sounds like the fragrance business were a little bit less stability to recover costs and the naturals exposure?

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, I think as I mentioned earlier on Mark's question, we're going to have to look at productivity and what we can do from a productivity standpoint at the manufacturing level. We're going to have to look at what we can do to simplify and streamline the
componenttext: Yes, I think as I mentioned earlier on Mark's question, we're going to have to look at productivity and what we can do from a productivity standpoint at the manufacturing level. We're going to have to look at what we can do to simplify and streamline the organization and the overhead levels and we're going to have to look towards as I mentioned earlier, the benefits associated with embedding ZBB-type principles across the organization and all 3 of those things are going to enable us to manage, as I said earlier, manage the dynamic between profitability, growth, our expectations and our ability to invest in the business long term.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Mike Sison from KeyBanc.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Mike Sison from KeyBanc.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016

componenttext: So when I take a look at the third quarter currency sales growth outlook relative to what you said in the second quarter, it was actually up so it's a little bit better, and then you talked about some of the headwinds you faced and your currency neutral operating profit growth is lower than you said in the second quarter. How long do you think it will take to sort of flush through some of these issues? And I would imagine you think that the leverage on operating profit growth should be better than sales growth, right?

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, as I said in my remarks earlier, for Q4, operating profit leverage will in Q4 be better than top line. I think that that's despite the incentive comp reset that I mentioned earlier. I think in medium, short medium term, we're still going to -- we sti
componenttext: Yes, as I said in my remarks earlier, for Q4, operating profit leverage will in Q4 be better than top line. I think that that's despite the incentive comp reset that I mentioned earlier. I think in medium, short medium term, we're still going to -- we still expect pressures on sales mix, Fine Fragrance is still going to be pressured and I think if you think about early next year, Q1 was the strongest quarter we had for Fine and so that's going to -- I think it's going to be very challenging as we start next year so as we look into next year, we're going to be -- we're planning and we're acting on a conservative basis and I don't think that we're sitting here saying that there's going to be a robust environment, a robust recovery next year.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Right, right. Okay. And what I think about acquisitions, you've mentioned are going to add about $150 million in sales growth next year, it's about 5%. Does that or should that lever to a similar amount of EPS growth next year?
componenttext: Right, right. Okay. And what I think about acquisitions, you've mentioned are going to add about $150 million in sales growth next year, it's about 5%. Does that or should that lever to a similar amount of EPS growth next year?

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: That's probably a bit early. It's Andreas taking it because we will integrate these companies fully next year so David Michael, we have closed the deal early October. So we need some time to make sure that we integrated well into our platform here. It's a
componenttext: That's probably a bit early. It's Andreas taking it because we will integrate these companies fully next year so David Michael, we have closed the deal early October. So we need some time to make sure that we integrated well into our platform here. It's actually turning organic in the fourth quarter next year. And the other deal with Fragrance Resources, we will hopefully close early '17 so that will take some time to extract, let's say, to integrate it very, very well into our network as well. So it will help us quite significantly on the top line growth as you just outlined. But Rich might comment on the cost side.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, so Mike, from a profitability perspective, EPS, I think as you saw in our commentary, we expected EPS accretive but it's not going to be anywhere near that impact from a profit standpoint because we're going to have to step up basis and so as we saw
componenttext: Yes, so Mike, from a profitability perspective, EPS, I think as you saw in our commentary, we expected EPS accretive but it's not going to be anywhere near that impact from a profit standpoint because we're going to have to step up basis and so as we saw with Lucas Meyer, as we saw with Ottens, particularly early on, it's not going to have much of an impact at all on operating profit, depending upon what comes out of the valuation work. On a cash basis or an EBITDA basis, it certainly will be more positive. And then overtime, as Andreas alluded to, as we're able to integrate the two acquisitions and drive the business rationale and synergies, we're able to start to get more and more of an impact on an operating profit basis.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: And as we always said, we started last year with our first two acquisitions. We haven't done too many over the last 15 years, but now, we are getting a little bit more skilled also integrating these assets into our network and as fast as we can do it, as
componenttext: And as we always said, we started last year with our first two acquisitions. We haven't done too many over the last 15 years, but now, we are getting a little bit more skilled also integrating these assets into our network and as fast as we can do it, as fast as we can produce results here. So we are actually pretty well on track with that and I'm very satisfied with the progress we are making on the M&A frontier because that gives us another, let's say critical mass we can basically play with.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016

componenttext: Your next question comes from John Roberts with UBS.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Could you actually elaborate a little bit more on the fragrance ingredients strength? It was up double-digit in most areas and a little bit more detail on the North American Beverage weakness. What's behind that?
componenttext: Could you actually elaborate a little bit more on the fragrance ingredients strength? It was up double-digit in most areas and a little bit more detail on the North American Beverage weakness. What's behind that?

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: I'll get started so John, first of all, good morning, it's Andreas. On the fragrance ingredients, it's quite a remarkable turnaround we are seeing here and it's basically led to a couple of factors. Let's start with the not so exciting one, it's technical
componenttext: I'll get started so John, first of all, good morning, it's Andreas. On the fragrance ingredients, it's quite a remarkable turnaround we are seeing here and it's basically led to a couple of factors. Let's start with the not so exciting one, it's technically because we are cycling through with one of our big customers we lost before so the comparison is a bit better for us. But also the strategy is revamped now and Nicholas and his team have done a great job to look into the business and to our customers, made a good, let's say in terms of targeting the right customers and started also selling of our more captive molecules earlier, which is actually bringing us a greater value creation already upfront. We have waited probably too long in the past and these two are, let's say, two measures that's really helped us to revamp the ingredients business after 2 years of really not so good performance. We're pretty happy with what we're seeing here. Does that answer your question, John?

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016

componenttext: Yes. And then North American Beverage?

componenttextpreview: North American Beverage.
componenttext: North American Beverage.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: I think some of it is, as we talked about or alluded to earlier, I mean, I think the win performance in both business is pretty good, but particularly in some of the Beverage on the flavors side, the lifecycle of those wins has been shorter than what we'v
componenttext: I think some of it is, as we talked about or alluded to earlier, I mean, I think the win performance in both business is pretty good, but particularly in some of the Beverage on the flavors side, the lifecycle of those wins has been shorter than what we've seen in the past so the erosion impact is principally what's driving down or pressuring the performance year-over-year.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016

componenttext: Okay. Then Rich, I think you said compliance and litigation costs reduced margins by 100 bps versus a year ago. Could you provide some additional details on that?

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, I mean, the drivers really are 2 things. One, you saw in the Q that we have a case going on and we're actively pursuing that and vigorously defending that, but that costs money. And as we prepare for trial, potential trial early next year, we're gett
componenttext: Yes, I mean, the drivers really are 2 things. One, you saw in the Q that we have a case going on and we're actively pursuing that and vigorously defending that, but that costs money. And as we prepare for trial, potential trial early next year, we're getting prepared around. That's a piece of it. The bigger piece of that is really related to the reach requirements in the fragrance business and it goes through a cycle where there's another -- the next cycle is in 2018 and so we have to prepare for the registrations now when we incur costs this year, we incur again next year and then the following year potentially get a little bit of money back from other companies that use our products. But that's -- it's really the registration and compliance costs associated with our materials that we operate within the European environment.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Faiza Alwy with Deutsche.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Faiza Alwy with Deutsche.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: So I just wanted to again go back to North American flavors. So Ottens was in the base this quarter. Can you talk about how that business performs because I think the worry is that I know it's run separately, but do you think you're experiencing any dissy
componenttext: So I just wanted to again go back to North American flavors. So Ottens was in the base this quarter. Can you talk about how that business performs because I think the worry is that I know it's run separately, but do you think you're experiencing any dissynergies as Ottens becomes part of a larger company and some of your customers are more used to doing business with a company that's more agile and quick to deliver a solution?

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Actually not, because we keep that platform quite separate in terms of how they act. The only thing we are doing is that we are delivering our technologies to make sure that they can use these more high tech solutions as well. So these synergies, we don't
componenttext: Actually not, because we keep that platform quite separate in terms of how they act. The only thing we are doing is that we are delivering our technologies to make sure that they can use these more high tech solutions as well. So these synergies, we don't see actually so now the next thing is actually combine it with David Michael because that's important. The good thing is that both companies are in Philadelphia, which makes it much easier than it would've been in different cities. So no, we don't see dissynergies and you might comment on.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, Faiza, as I think as I mentioned earlier, I think one market I think is pressured and that certainty concerns certain key clients. The lifecycle on wins was not a factor. I think we expect to see improvement and a strong rebound in Q4 so I think it's
componenttext: Yes, Faiza, as I think as I mentioned earlier, I think one market I think is pressured and that certainty concerns certain key clients. The lifecycle on wins was not a factor. I think we expect to see improvement and a strong rebound in Q4 so I think it's -- I think it's more short term than we think anything long term or structural.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, great. And then Rich, could you just expand on the manufacturing costs? I think you said that was on the fragrance ingredients business. So was there something specific that happened this quarter and it's not expected to continue next quarter or jus
componenttext: Okay, great. And then Rich, could you just expand on the manufacturing costs? I think you said that was on the fragrance ingredients business. So was there something specific that happened this quarter and it's not expected to continue next quarter or just a little more detail around that.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure, no problem. I think it's really -- it is primarily manufacturing yields in the ingredients business that I alluded to earlier. Q3 last year was the very strong results so I would say above average productivity. Our planning was expected to be more o
componenttext: Sure, no problem. I think it's really -- it is primarily manufacturing yields in the ingredients business that I alluded to earlier. Q3 last year was the very strong results so I would say above average productivity. Our planning was expected to be more or less more in line with historical trends so on average, and we came in below that in the quarter. So the year-over-year impact is bigger than the absolute impact. I don't think it's structural. I think there's a lot going on in the fragrance ingredients business in terms of the runs in the product mix, which we're working through and working to optimize, but I don't think it's a long term challenge. I think it's certainly the big impact was a function of year-over-year performance going to different directions.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016

componenttext: No, 50%, Silke, let's come back on that one off-line, but I mean I think you can look at -- if you look at the kind of amortization levels that are in the Q in terms that we provide visibility in the Q and the press release, I would exactly expect similar levels. In terms of strategic investments you're making, do you expect to make similar investments in 2017 and is there any quantifiable benefit that you can indicate because this is something you see a benefit over a 2-year period or a 3-year period, like what do you get from it?

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016
componenttextpreview: I talked about the reach expenses which is more in the compliance and from the strategic investment standpoint, some of those, some of that work was related to embedding the ZBB principles and as I mentioned earlier, we will expect to begin to get those b
componenttext: I talked about the reach expenses which is more in the compliance and from the strategic investment standpoint, some of those, some of that work was related to embedding the ZBB principles and as I mentioned earlier, we will expect to begin to get those benefits next year and I would expect those things to continue to build over the medium and long term. I'm not ready to say today exactly what those are but we're going to get benefits related to that. Another key part of it is, key part of the strategic investments is more the overall profitability that the business leverage not only on the operating profit line, but at the EPS line.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016

componenttext: And is there like a level of investment you expect for next year that's quantifiable?

componenttextpreview: I think year-over-year, the level of investment will likely go down a little bit next year versus this year. It's part of the dynamic that I mentioned earlier of managing strategic investments versus growth versus reinvestment in the business and we've go
componenttext: I think year-over-year, the level of investment will likely go down a little bit next year versus this year. It's part of the dynamic that I mentioned earlier of managing strategic investments versus growth versus reinvestment in the business and we've got to work with the entire management team and working that balance and so part of that will be moving those 3 levers, but I do expect some of those costs to come down year-over-year.

headline: International Flavors & Fragrances Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 08, 2016

componenttext: I probably can take it. I would say, first of all, it depends on the category or on the business. We see still growth in flavors but in all parts of the region, Europe, Africa Middle East and that's one thing. We certainly see stronger growth in Africa Middle East here than we see in Western Europe so it's not great growth trends we're seeing. In general also on the fragrance business, it's slower than what we see in other regions of the world.

componenttextpreview: Certainly for Fine Fragrance. So I think it's a tougher environment for us. The Brexit, I would say there's no impact for us right now despite the currency impact. We're all having it at the moment and it all depends how finally the deal is negotiated wit
componenttext: Certainly for Fine Fragrance. So I think it's a tougher environment for us. The Brexit, I would say there's no impact for us right now despite the currency impact. We're all having it at the moment and it all depends how finally the deal is negotiated with the U.K. and the rest of Europe. But right now, I think it's a pretty limited impact we are seeing.
